intro: Nissolia guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan nissolia, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its flowers are often pink or purple, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Nissolia guatemalensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
